title: Cooking gauntlets

properties.name: description
properties.value: Cooking gauntlets are a pair of gloves available after completing the Family Crest quest, along with the goldsmith and chaos gauntlets. They can be worn to significantly decrease the likelihood of burning lobsters, swordfish, monkfish, sharks and anglerfish when cooking them. They do not work on other types of food.[1]

Cooking gauntlets

Cooking gauntlets are a pair of gloves available after completing the Family Crest quest, along with the goldsmith and chaos gauntlets. They can be worn to significantly decrease the likelihood of burning lobsters, swordfish, monkfish, sharks and anglerfish when cooking them. They do not work on other types of food.[1]

In order to obtain this enchantment on your Family Crest gauntlets, one must bring the steel gauntlets that were rewarded from the quest to Caleb in or around the house north of the archery shop in Catherby. (Note: if your gauntlets have a different enchantment on them already, Caleb will charge you 25,000 coins). If the gauntlets are destroyed or lost due to death, these gauntlets may be re-obtained free of charge from Dimintheis in south-east Varrock and will have the same enchantment on them.

The text that appears when you give your gauntlets to Caleb is: "Caleb takes the gauntlets from you, pours some herbs and seasonings on them, bakes them on his range for a short period of time, and then hands them back to you."

The gauntlets cannot be taken to Entrana.

After the miniquest Family Pest has been completed, the player can claim the cooking gauntlets from Caleb at any time. They will not be charged 25,000 coins for additional pairs, and may own multiple forms of the Family Crest gauntlets simultaneously.

Burn Level[edit | edit source]

Main article: Cooking/Burn level

When players have reached level 99 in Cooking, they can buy a Cooking cape, which will allow the player to never burn food again whilst equipped, thus allowing the player to stop wearing the cooking gauntlets. In addition, the Cooking cape works on all foods, whereas the gauntlets only work on the following five fish:

Food Fire Range? Hosidius? Gauntlets Experience Members?
5% 10%[h 1] Default Hosidius 5% Hosidius 10%[h 1]
Lobster 74 74 70 N/A 64 61 N/A 120 0
Swordfish 86 81 76 N/A 81 76 N/A 140 0
Monkfish 92 90 86 82 87 82 N/A 150 1
Shark N/A N/A N/A 99 94 89 84 210 1
Anglerfish N/A N/A N/A N/A 98 93 88 230 1
  1. ^ 1.0 1.1 The value will be N/A if the level required to not burn with the Elite Kourend & Kebos Diary completed is lower than the level required to complete the diary (level 84).

Treasure Trails[edit | edit source]

The cooking gauntlets is the item Falo requires players to show him when he sings about: These gloves of white won't help you fight, but aid in cooking, they just might.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
30 August 2005
(update)

The "Drop" option was replaced with a "Destroy" option.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 8 January 2020. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "[Also a quick confirmation too, the gauntlets really only work for fish above Tuna, correct?] Lobster, swordfish, shark, anglerfish, monkfish."

rawContent: {{External|rs|rsc=Gauntlets of cooking}} {{Infobox Item |name = Cooking gauntlets |image = [[File:Cooking gauntlets.png]] |release = [[9 April]] [[2002]] |update = New members quest online! |members = Yes |quest = [[Family Crest]] |tradeable = No |placeholder = Yes |equipable = Yes |stackable = No |noteable = No |options = Wear |destroy = You can obtain another set of Cooking gauntlets from Dimintheis. |examine = These gauntlets empower with a greater ability to cook fish. |value = 1 |weight = 0.226 |id = 775 }} [[File:Cooking gauntlets detail.png|left|130px]] '''Cooking gauntlets''' are a pair of [[gloves]] available after completing the [[Family Crest]] quest, along with the [[goldsmith gauntlets|goldsmith]] and [[chaos gauntlets]]. They can be worn to significantly decrease the likelihood of burning [[lobster]]s, [[swordfish]], [[monkfish]], [[sharks]] and [[anglerfish]] when [[cooking]] them. They do not work on other types of food.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1214838053681975296|date=8 January 2020|archiveurl=https://archive.is/4Rgkn|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=[Also a quick confirmation too, the gauntlets really only work for fish above Tuna, correct?] Lobster, swordfish, shark, anglerfish, monkfish.}} In order to obtain this enchantment on your Family Crest gauntlets, one must bring the [[steel gauntlets]] that were rewarded from the quest to [[Caleb]] in or around the house north of the [[Hickton's Archery Emporium|archery shop]] in [[Catherby]]. (Note: if your gauntlets have a different enchantment on them already, Caleb will charge you 25,000 [[coins]]). If the gauntlets are destroyed or lost due to death, these gauntlets may be re-obtained free of charge from [[Dimintheis]] in south-east [[Varrock]] and will have the same enchantment on them. The text that appears when you give your gauntlets to Caleb is: "''Caleb takes the gauntlets from you, pours some herbs and seasonings on them, bakes them on his range for a short period of time, and then hands them back to you.''" The gauntlets cannot be taken to [[Entrana]]. After the miniquest [[Family Pest]] has been completed, the player can claim the cooking gauntlets from Caleb at any time. They will not be charged 25,000 coins for additional pairs, and may own multiple forms of the Family Crest gauntlets simultaneously. {{Infobox Bonuses |astab = +2 |aslash = +2 |acrush = +2 |amagic = 0 |arange = 0 |dstab = +8 |dslash = +9 |dcrush = +7 |dmagic = 0 |drange = 0 |str = +2 |rstr = 0 |mdmg = 0 |prayer = 0 |slot = hands |image = [[File:Cooking gauntlets equipped.png|130px]] |altimage = [[File:Cooking gauntlets equipped female.png|130px]] }} ==Burn Level== {{Main|Cooking/Burn level}} When players have reached level 99 in Cooking, they can buy a [[Cooking cape]], which will allow the player to never burn food again whilst equipped, thus allowing the player to stop wearing the cooking gauntlets.
